meanings.sent1: The fishing line formed a tangle in the tackle box.
meanings.sent2: I had to carefully untangle the tangle of wires behind the TV.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics resulted in a tangle of yarn around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a tangle of confusion after the long day.
meanings.sent5: The branches created a tangle that was hard to navigate through.

meanings.sent1: The vines tangle around the tree trunk in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to tangle the necklace when you put it on.
meanings.sent3: The puppies tangle themselves up in a playful game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The dancers tangle their ribbons in a graceful display of movement.
meanings.sent5: The phone cord always seems to tangle no matter how neatly it's stored.

meanings.definition: To involve in a complicated situation
meanings.sent1: I didn't want to tangle with the complicated instructions.
meanings.sent2: She unknowingly tangles herself in a web of lies.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to tangle with the case despite the risks.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to tangle his opponent in a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The students tangle with the challenging math problem during class.
